avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the occasionally moderate westerly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form on Monday. The fresh wind slabs will be deposited on unfavourable layers in all aspects. These are mostly rather small but can in some cases be released easily, in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. This applies in particular on very steep slopes.
In isolated cases avalanches can penetrate down to the ground.
Natural dry avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Little snow fell on Saturday in some localities. On Monday the wind will be moderate at times in some localities.
In some places wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface.
Steep sunny slopes: Underneath the fresh snow there is a more or less load-bearing refreezing crust.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Beware of numerous exposed rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The little fresh snow and small drift accumulations were deposited on a weak layer of old snow, especially on the shaded slopes at medium and high altitudes.
As a consequence of the occasionally moderate westerly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form on Monday.
Dry avalanches can in some places be released in the weakly bonded old snow by small loads, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on very steep slopes. These places are sometimes covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow, and up to 15 cm in some localities, fell on Saturday above approximately 2000 m. The westerly wind will transport the new snow.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying. Also on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. Also at low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the occasionally moderate westerly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form on Monday. Dry avalanches can be released by small loads. In particular transitions into gullies and bowls where weaknesses exist in the old snowpack are unfavourable, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise. In some places avalanches can penetrate down to the ground.
Individual mostly small natural avalanches are possible, in particular on extreme slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 2000 m.
On Monday the wind will be moderate at times in some localities.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
Steep sunny slopes: Underneath the fresh snow there is a more or less load-bearing refreezing crust.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.
